intro: Gardoquia striata, commonly known as the streaked gardoquia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with distinct longitudinal stripes. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Gardoquia striata thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its elegant appearance and seasonal blooming habit.
